org.jtrim.access

Class RightGroupHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.access.RightGroupHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AccessStateListener<HierarchicalRight>

    public final class RightGroupHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements AccessStateListener<HierarchicalRight>
    Defines an AccessStateListener which can keep track of the availability of a group of rights. The RightGroupHandler must be added to an AccessManager which notifies the RightGroupHandler of changes in the availability of rights. Note however, that this implementation can only handle HierarchicalRight as rights.

    To use this class add the instance of RightGroupHandler to an AccessManager (e.g.: for a HierarchicalAccessManager, it must be specified in the constructor) and then specify the right groups and the action to take when the group of right becomes available or unavailable by calling the addGroupListener method.

    Thread safety

    Instances of RightGroupHandler are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently but not however, that if onEnterState is called concurrently with another onEnterState of the same RightGroupHandler may cause the state of right availability to be impossible.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent but they do not wait for any external event and return relatively quickly.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RightGroupHandler()
      Creates a new RightGroupHandler which does not yet monitors the state of any right group.

    • Method Detail

      • multiAction

        public static AccessChangeAction multiAction(AccessChangeAction... actions)
        Creates an AccessChangeAction which when notified, notifies all the AccessChangeAction instances specified in the arguments.

        Even if an AccessChangeAction throws an exception, other AccessChangeAction instances will still be notified. However, the first exception thrown by the underlying AccessChangeAction instances will be rethrown to the called of the AccessChangeAction returned by this method. If more than one AccessChangeAction throws an exception, others will suppressed.

        Parameters:
        actions - the AccessChangeAction instance to be called by the returned AccessChangeAction. This argument and its elements cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the AccessChangeAction which when notified, notifies all the AccessChangeAction instances specified in the arguments. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the argument or one of its element is null

      • addGroupListener

        public org.jtrim.event.ListenerRef addGroupListener(java.util.Collection<HierarchicalRight> readRights,
                                           java.util.Collection<HierarchicalRight> writeRights,
                                           boolean lazyNotify,
                                           AccessChangeAction accessChangeAction)
        Adds a group of rights which this RightGroupHandler must monitor for availability. Whenever the availability of the group of rights changes, the specified AccessChangeAction is invoked to take the appropriate action.
        Parameters:
        readRights - the Collection of rights for which read access is required. Read access is granted to a particular right if there is no conflicting write access. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty Collection. The content of this passed Collection is copied by this method and modifying the Collection after this method has no effect on this RightGroupHandler.
        writeRights - the Collection of rights for which write access is required. Read access is granted to a particular right if there is no conflicting write or read access. This argument can be null which is equivalent to passing an empty Collection. The content of this passed Collection is copied by this method and modifying the Collection after this method has no effect on this RightGroupHandler.
        lazyNotify - if this argument is false, the specified AccessChangeAction will be notified always when a state of any given right change regardless if this change resulted in a change in the availability of the right group. Otherwise, the AccessChangeAction will only be notified if the availability of the right group changes.
        accessChangeAction - the listener to be notified when the availability of the specified rights changes. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the ListenerRef which can be used to stop listening for the currently specified group of rights. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified accessChangeAction is null
        See Also:
        multiAction(AccessChangeAction[])

      • onEnterState

        public void onEnterState(AccessManager<?,HierarchicalRight> accessManager,
                HierarchicalRight right,
                AccessState state)
        Checks whether any right group became available or unavailable and notifies the registered AccessChangeAction instances if so.

        If an invoked AccessChangeAction.onChangeAccess(AccessManager, boolean) method throws an unchecked exception, it will be rethrown to the caller after all the AccessChangeAction listeners were notified. Only the first thrown exception will be rethrown, subsequent exceptions will be suppressed.

        Specified by:
        onEnterState in interface AccessStateListener<HierarchicalRight>
        Parameters:
        accessManager - the AccessManager in which the given right is managed. This argument cannot be null.
        right - the right which has changed state. This argument can only be null if the AccessManager supports null rights.
        state - the new state which is true for the specified right (or rights). This argument cannot be null.
